name: tida.color
comment:
Color description module. Contains a structure for manipulating colors like RGB, there,
    and other ways to set colors. Mostly the RGB format is used, and the use of other formats
    will be converted to RGB.

    Authors: TodNaz
    License: MIT

name: tida.event
comment:
Event handler module.

    Authors: TodNaz
    License: MIT

members.name: initEventHandler
members.comment:
Initializes an event handler.

    Params:
        window = For which window to process events.

members.name: this
members.comment:
Initializes an event handler.

        Params:
            window = For which window to process events.

members.name: update
members.comment:
Updates the event queue. Returns whether there are events in the queue.
        On each call, the queue is advanced.

members.name: isKeyDown
members.comment: Returns a state indicating whether a key is pressed.

members.name: isKeyUp
members.comment: Returns a state indicating whether a key is released.

members.name: isResize
members.comment: Returns whether the window has been resized.

members.name: resizeWindowSize
members.comment: Returns whether the window has been resized.

members.name: fps
members.comment:
Give current FPS.

        Returns:
            float - FPS

members.name: drawEx
members.originalType: @trusted void(Renderer renderer, Vecf position, float angle, Vecf center, Vecf size)

members.name: drawColor
members.originalType: @trusted void(Renderer renderer, Vecf position, Color!ubyte color)

name: tida.graph.image
comment:
A module for describing an image. This module provides control
    of the image both with a surface and with a texture.

    Authors: TodNaz
    License: MIT

members.name: this
members.comment:
Creates a surface with the specified size. Note that it is
        not yet a texture, and you don’t need to draw it right away,
        to do this, convert it to a texture.

        Params:
            newWidth = Image width.
            newHeight = Image height.

members.name: this
members.comment:
Loads a surface from a file. Supported formats are described here:
        `https://code.dlang.org/packages/imageformats`

        Params:
            path = Relative or full path to the image file.

members.name: bytes
members.comment:
Gives a sequence of bytes that encodes a color in
        the specified color format.

        Params:
            format = Pixel format.

members.name: colors
members.comment:
Returns a sequence of pixels in the format `0xRRGGBBAA` (Depending on the format).

        Params:
            format = Pixel format.

members.name: setPixel
members.comment:
Set the pixel at the specified location.

        Params:
            x = The x-axis position pixel.
            y = The y-axis position pixel.
            color = Pixel.
members.originalType: @trusted void(size_t x, size_t y, Color!ubyte color)

members.name: getPixel
members.comment:
Returns the pixel at the specified location.

        Params:
            x = The x-axis position pixel.
            y = The y-axis position pixel.

members.name: blit
members.comment: Attaches an image to itself at the specified position.

members.name: create
members.comment:
Creates a surface with the specified size. Note that it is
        not yet a texture, and you don’t need to draw it right away,
        to do this, convert it to a texture.

        Params:
            newWidth = Image width.
            newHeight = Image height.

members.name: load
members.comment:
Loads a surface from a file. Supported formats are described here:
        `https://code.dlang.org/packages/imageformats`

        Params:
            path = Relative or full path to the image file.

members.name: fromTexture
members.comment: Convert to a texture for rendering to the window.

members.name: dup
members.comment: Creates a copy of the picture. Doesn't create a copy of the texture.

members.name: drawEx
members.originalType: void(Renderer renderer, Vecf position, float angle, Vecf center, Vecf size)

members.name: drawColor
members.originalType: void(Renderer renderer, Vecf position, Color!ubyte color)

members.name: freeTexture
members.comment: Destroys the texture, not the image.

members.name: freePixels
members.comment: Frees up space for pixels. Does not destroy texture.

members.name: free
members.comment: Frees memory completely from texture and pixels.

name: tida.graph.render
comment:
Module for drawing in a window using opengl.

    Authors: TodNaz
    License: MIT

members.comment:
Draws only a regular triangle.

        Params:
            points = Tringle vertex.
            color = Triangle color.
            isFill = Triangle is filled.
members.originalType: @safe void(Vecf[3] points, Color!ubyte color, bool isFill = true)

members.name: rectangle
members.comment:
Draws a rectangle.

        Params:
            position = Rectangle position.
            width = Rectangle width.
            height = Rectangle height.
            color = Rectangle color.
            isFill = Rectangle is filled.
members.originalType: @safe void(Vecf position, float width, float height, Color!ubyte color, bool isFill = true)

members.name: line
members.comment:
Draws a line.

        Params:
            points = Line vertex.
            color = Line color.

members.name: circle
members.comment:
Draws a circle.

        Params:
            position = Circle position.
            radious = Circle radious.
            color = Circle color.
            isFill = Circle is filled.
members.originalType: @safe void(Vecf position, float radious, Color!ubyte color, bool isFill)

members.name: draw
members.comment:
Draws characters rendered by the text class.

        Params:
            symbols = Symbols rendered.
            position = Text position.

members.originalType: @safe void(IDrawableEx drawable, Vecf position, float angle, Vecf center, Vecf size)

members.originalType: @safe void(IDrawableColor drawable, Vecf position, Color!ubyte color)

members.originalType: @safe (Image img, Vecf pos, Color!ubyte color = rgb(255, 255, 255))

name: tida.info
comment:
Module for system information.

members.name: getWidth
members.comment: Returns the width of the monitor.

members.name: getHeight
members.comment: Returns the height of the monitor.

name: tida.runtime
comment:
Runtime module. Serves to save some globally significant variables in the library.

    To create a runtime, you just need to call one function for this:
    ---
    TidaRuntime.initialize(args);
    ---

    So it will automatically remember the program arguments and create all the
    conditions for creating a window.

    Authors: TodNaz
    License: MIT

members.name: initialize
members.comment: Creates and initializes a runtime for the program.

members.name: args
members.comment: Returns the arguments that were passed at runtime.

members.name: display
members.comment: Returns a display open in x11 environment.

members.name: xDisplayOpen
members.comment: Opens the display in x11 environment.

name: tida.vector
comment:
Module for information about positioning elements.

    Authors: TodNaz
    License: MIT

members.comment:
Vector structure. Two-dimensional, because the framework does not
    imply 3D capabilities.
members.name: Vector
intX
members.comment:
Gives x coordinate in int format
        Returns:
            int

members.name: intY
members.comment:
Gives y coordinate in int format
        Returns:
            int

name: tida.window
comment:
A module for working with windows in a cross-platform environment.
    A window is created in both Windows and Linux environments. OS X
    and other operating systems are currently not supported due to
    lack of testing on these platforms.

    The window is created primarily not in the constructor, in the constructor
    the window parameters are initialized for its creation. All this is created
    by the `initialize` method, with an indication of the template parameter,
    which window to create.

    A window can be created either with a ready-made context or without it
    (i.e., created manually)(Please note that the context is strictly created
    only for the opengl library).

    Creating a simple window is done with a simple `initialize` function:
    ---
    /*
        We just allocate memory for the window, this is not yet the
        stages of its creation.
    */
    Window window = new Window(640,480,"MyTitle");

    /*
        Creates a simple window with no graphics context.
    */
    window.initialize!Simple;
    ---

    There are two ways to create a context:
    1. Initialize the window immediately with the context:
    ---
    window.initialize!ContextIn;
    ---
    2. Create it manually:
    ---
    window.initialize!Simple;

    Context context = new Context();

    /*
        Indicates the attributes of the context.
    */
    context.attrib = GLAttributes(...);
    context.attribInitialize(window);
    context.initialize(window);

    /*
        Sets the context to this window.
    */
    window.contextSet(context);
    ---

    Then you can draw something on the window, control it and so on.

    Also, please note that creating multiple windows is currently not supported.

    TODO:
        * Make it possible to create several windows at the same time.
          Namely, to make `shared` methods for working in different threads,
          both for the window and for the context, event handler and render.

    Authors: TodNaz
    License: MIT

members.name: Simple
members.comment:
A property to create just a window, without creating a context.
    Initialize it like this:
    ---
    window.initialize!Simple;
    ---

members.name: ContextIn
members.comment:
Property for creating a window with a context for graphics.
    It is initialized like this:
    ---
    window.initialize!ContextIn;
    ---

members.name: ParrarelContext
members.comment: Property for creating a window on another thread. It is not used now.

members.name: Empty
members.comment: The shell is empty. Only needed in WebAssembly mode.

members.name: Context
members.comment: Class for describing and creating context for the window.

members.name: xAttribInitialize
members.comment:
Initializes the context parameters in the x11 environment.

        All parameters are taken from the attrib variable. The default will always be double buffering.

members.name: xContextInitialize
members.comment: Creates a context in the x11 environment.

members.name: attribInitialize
members.comment: Initializes the parameters of the context.

members.name: this
members.comment:
Initialization of window parameters.

        Note:
            * The window will not be created, but the parameters for its creation will be initialized.

        Params:
            newWidth = The width of the window when created.
            newHeight = The height of the window when created.
            newTitle = The title of the window when created.

Initializes the window according to the parameters.

        A window can be created with the following parameters:
        * `Simple` - Will create a simple window with no context when
                     you need to manually create it.
        * `ContextIn` - Creates a window with a context for graphics.

        Params:
            Type = What type of window to initialize.
            posX = The x-axis position.
            posY = The y-axis position.
members.name: initialize
xWindowInit
members.comment:
Initializes the window for the context.

        Params:
            posX = The x-axis position.
            posY = The y-axis position.
            visual = Information from context for create window.

members.name: xWindowSimpleInitialize
members.comment:
Created simple window in environment x11.

        Params:
            posX = The x-axis position.
            posY = The y-axis position.

members.name: contextSet
members.comment:
Sets an _initialized_ context.

        Params:
            context = Initialized context.

members.name: xContextSet
members.comment: Sets an _initialized_ context of x11 environment.

members.name: xResize
members.originalType: @trusted void(immutable uint newWidth, immutable uint newHeight)

members.name: xMove
members.originalType: @trusted void(immutable int posX, immutable int posY)

members.name: move
members.comment:
Moves the window to the specified location.

        Params:
            posX = New X-axis position window.
            posY = New Y-axis position window.
members.originalType: @safe void(immutable int posX, immutable int posY)

members.name: resize
members.comment:
Resizes the window.

        Params:
            newWidth = Window width.
            newHeight = Window height.
members.originalType: @safe void(immutable uint newWidth, immutable uint newHeight)
